intro: Shinnersoseris rostrata, commonly known as the rostrate serotina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a conical shape, and the plant produces small, dry fruits known as cypselae. Shinnersoseris rostrata is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
